title: Great but not perfect
comment: The app is great and it has all of the non-third party information organized, and thankfully allows multiple bookmark folders to handle my different characters. I wish I could leave a 4.5 because I love the app but can't say it's perfect yet.  -too many clicks to navigate bookmarks -no page linking -no tabs -the search is a bit messy  Navigation has a few problems. It takes too many clicks to navigate through bookmarks (go to home, open bookmarks tab, select bookmark tab name, then scroll through your bookmarks). The app does not support tabs so you can't have multiple items open. I find this unfortunate because I would prefer to permanently have my familiar's page open as well as the spell I plan on casting next, as well as my list of summons. There is no linking between pages which would take a lot of programming, but would make Summon Monster and similar spells much more useful. Being able to open a spell on a monster's page would also benefit greatly from page linking. Searching is messy and doesn't prioritize the same way d20pfsrd does.  I am very happy with this app, don't take what I say too negatively. If you haven't downloaded this and you play Pathfinder: do it.

Come join the beta: first join: https://plus.google.com/communities/115367918448287661404 then go to: https://play.google.com/apps/testing/org.evilsoft.pathfinder.reference. Tabs are a space problem, I want to devote most of the interface to the rules. In the beta I added History which makes jumping back and forth a snap. Come see if you like it.

title: Excellent Core Reference
comment: If you want an app to browse all of the core books for Pathfinder, then this is the app for you. Improvements that would make this better include: the official erratas from the books, updated spell descriptions (such as Bestow Curse having the "curse" subschool), and the search feature ordering results by relevancy. I would recommend the app for rules reference at the table, but would NOT rely on it as a rules lawyer. For PFS play, the app does not have any of the periferal books, FYI.

The app is built off of paizo's Pathfinder System Reference Document.  It's been up to date on errata except for the latest eratta released on 1/24/2014.  The app with those rules is in beta now, expected to release in a few weeks.  Interesting note on bestow curse, I'll have to look into that.
